qas.question: Queen's Live at Wembley Stadium DVD covered what year?
Queen on Fire included this 1982 concert?
When was Queen's A Night at the Opera re-released?
When was the first Queen Bluray released?
Which band members were involved in the restoration of Queen's prior projects?

context: Under the supervision of <a4_0>May and Taylor<a4_0/>, numerous restoration projects have been under way involving Queen's lengthy audio and video catalogue. DVD releases of their <a0_0>1986<a0_0/> Wembley concert (titled Live at Wembley Stadium), 1982 <a1_0>Milton Keynes<a1_0/> concert (Queen on Fire – Live at the Bowl), and two Greatest Video Hits (Volumes 1 and 2, spanning the 1970s and 1980s) have seen the band's music remixed into 5.1 and DTS surround sound. So far, only two of the band's albums, A Night at the Opera and The Game, have been fully remixed into high-resolution multichannel surround on DVD-Audio. A Night at the Opera was re-released with some revised 5.1 mixes and accompanying videos in <a2_0>2005<a2_0/> for the 30th anniversary of the album's original release (CD+DVD-Video set). In <a3_0>2007<a3_0/>, a Blu-ray edition of Queen's previously released concerts, Queen Rock Montreal & Live Aid, was released, marking their first project in 1080p HD.
